intro: Galatella arrigens, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. It is often found in mountainous regions and has a low-growing habit with dense foliage. Galatella arrigens is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
